abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Ninth
            Poverty Reduction Support Credit Program (PRSC 9) for Uganda
            is to improved access to and greater value for money (VFM)
            in, public services. This program document presents a credit
            to the Republic of Uganda for SDR 65.2 million or US$100
            million equivalent to finance the PRSC 9. It is the second
            of three development policy operations (DPOs) to support
            Uganda's National Development Plan (NDP) and covers the
            period 2012-13. The PRSC 9 is prepared under the Joint
            Budget Support Framework (JBSF). The operation will improve
            efficiency in four service delivery sectors by addressing
            common key binding implementation constraints in public
            financial management (PFM), public service management and
            public administration, in tandem with sector-specific
            reforms within health, education, water and sanitation and
            transport. The PRSC 9 builds upon reforms initiated under
            the first (PRSC 8) operation of the series and provides the
            foundation for further reforms supported under the final
            operation of the series (PRSC 10). PRSC 9 focuses on two
            policy clusters: 1) reforms in public expenditure
            management, public financial management and public service
            management that improve service delivery and 2) value for
            money in public service delivery sectors. Measures supported
            by the operation include: improved budget credibility; more
            transparent and efficient public financial and sector
            management, focusing on accountability and improved service
            delivery systems at the local government level that should
            lead to better quality of education and health services.
